Posts.Content: Dec 16, 2007 09:52PM Labneal wrote: The doctor assured me the lesion wasn't solid because he couldn't feel it.  I don't really know anything about this kind of thing, but I believe I will see if I can get an appointment to see the breast specialist at UK hospital in the Markey Cancer Center.  I go there in Jan. for an ovarian cancer screening.  I'll keep in touch.  Thanks
Posts.Title: Nothing to worry about Labneal iodine

Posts.Content: Labneal wrote: I saw the surgeon yesterday and he assures me that the 2cm X1.5 cm lesion in my breast is a cyst ( nothing to worry about).  My GYN called me on Thursday with the "I am worried about your lymph nodes" and after worrying myself to death the whole weekend, I go on Monday to his office and get my films to take the surgeon.  He tells me they have re-looked at and re-measured the lymph nodes on the MRI and everything looks normal ( except the lesion).  He still wants me to see the suregon to have it biopsied.  But when I get to the surgeon's office , he reads all the records and says what I am seeing is a normal everything and if I lined up 100 women the majority would have cysts.  Praise God!  He just said if it started to change or if I began to feel it at anytime to call him.  That was the best Christmas present for my family and I.  Talking to you all has been a big help to me.  I will continue to check in and keep everyone in my prayers.  Merry Christmas with love, Pam Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Nothing to worry about Labneal iodine
